class.name: Votary
class.proficiency: Wisdom, Charisma, History, Insight, Medicine, Persuasion, Religion

feature.name: Starting Votary
feature.text: As a 1st-level votary, you begin play with 8+your Constitution modifier hit points.
You are proficient with the following items, in addition to any proficiencies provided by your race or background.
• Armor: light, medium, shields
• Weapons: simple
• Tools: none
• Skills: Choose 2 from History, Insight, Medicine, Persuasion, Religion
You begin play with the following equipment, in addition to any equipment provided by your background.
• (a) a mace or (b) a warhammer (if proficient)
• (a) scale mail, (b) leather armor, or (c) chain mail (if proficient)
• (a) a light crossbow and Crossbow Bolts (20) or (b) any simple weapon
• (a) a priest's pack or (b) an explorer's pack
• A shield and a holy symbol

feature.name: Multiclass Votary
feature.text: To multiclass as a votary, you must meet the following prerequisites:
• Wisdom 13
You gain the following proficiencies:
• Armor: light, medium, shields
• Weapons: none
• Tools: none

feature.name: Spellcasting
feature.text: As a conduit for divine power, you can cast votary spells. See chapter 10 for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 for a selection of votary spells.
Cantrips:

At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the votary spell list. You learn additional votary cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Votary table.
Preparing and Casting Spells:

The Votary table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your votary spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of votary spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the votary spell list. When you do so, choose a number of votary spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + your votary level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level votary, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell cure wounds, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of votary spells requires time spent in prayer and meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.
Spellcasting Ability:

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your votary spells. The power of your spells comes from your devotion to your deity. You use your Wisdom whenever a votary spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a votary spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Ritual Casting:
You can cast a votary spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.
Spellcasting Focus:
You can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus for your votary spells.

feature.name: Divine Domain
feature.text: Choose one domain related both to your vow and your deity. Each domain is detailed at the end of the class description, and each one provides examples of gods associated with it. Your choice grants you domain spells and other features when you choose it at 1st level. It also grants you additional ways to use Channel Divinity when you gain the feature at 2nd level, and additional benefits at 6th, 8th, and 17th levels.
Domain Spells:

Each domain has a list of spells—its domain spells—that you gain at the votary levels noted in the domain description. Once you gain a domain spell, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.
If you have a domain spell that doesn't appear on the votary spell list, the spell is nonetheless a votary spell for you.

feature.name: Divine Domain: Will Domain
feature.text: Cunning, strength, discipline, leadership—all are needed in order for those gods representing will. These generalist gods often have generalist devotees, or worshippers of varying expertises. Leader gods such as Odin may come to represent an idea as abstract as will.
At each indicated votary level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.
Will Domain Spells
Votary Level | Spells
1st | command, shield of faith
3rd | magic weapon, enhance ability
5th | haste, protection from energy
7th | freedom of movement, compulsion
9th | hold monster, destructive wave

feature.name: Channel Divinity (1/rest)
feature.text: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity and the relationship to your vow, using that energy to fuel magical effects. You start with two such effects: Turn Monstrosity and an effect determined by your domain. Some domains grant you additional effects as you advance in levels, as noted in the domain description.
When you use your Channel Divinity, you choose which effect to create. You must then finish a short or long rest to use your Channel Divinity again.
Some Channel Divinity effects require saving throws. When you use such an effect from this class, the DC equals your votary spell save DC.

Beginning at 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity twice between rests, and beginning at 18th level, you can use it three times between rests. When you finish a short or long rest, you regain your expended uses.

feature.name: Channel Divinity: Turn Monstrosity
feature.text: As an action, you speak your vow aloud and reference your patron deity. Each monstrosity that can see or hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

feature.name: Divine Domain feature
feature.text: At 2nd level, you gain a feature from your Divine Domain.

feature.name: Will Domain: Channel Divinity: Guided Strike
feature.text: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to strike with supernatural accuracy. When you make an attack roll, you can use your Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to the roll. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the attack hits or misses.

feature.name: Ability Score Improvement
feature.text: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.
Source: Player's Handbook p. 36

feature.name: Destroy Monstrosity (CR 1/2)
feature.text: Starting at 5th level, when a monstrosity of CR 1/2 or lower fails its saving throw against your Turn Monstrosity feature, the creature is instantly destroyed.
Source: Player's Handbook p. 36

feature.name: Channel Divinity (2/rest)
feature.text: Beginning at 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity twice between rests.

feature.name: Divine Domain feature
feature.text: At 6th level, you gain a feature from your Divine Domain.

feature.name: Will Domain: Channel Divinity: Temperance
feature.text: At 6th level, you can control some of the divine arcana granted to you by your vow and your patron deity. When a spell or class feature would cause you to enter a state in which you cannot cast or concentrate on magic (such as a barbarian's rage) you may instead choose to enter a tempered version of that state using your Channel Divinity. When you do, select one spell from your prepared votary spells or your votary domain. You may only cast this spell for the duration of your tempered state.
This feature does not allow you to cast magic while under the effects of antimagic field.

feature.name: Ability Score Improvement
feature.text: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

feature.name: Divine Domain feature
feature.text: At 8th level, you gain a feature from your Divine Domain.

feature.name: Will Domain: Divine Strike
feature.text: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

feature.name: Divine Intervention
feature.text: Beginning at 10th level, you can call on your deity to intervene on your behalf when your need is great.

Imploring your deity's aid requires you to use your action. Describe the assistance you seek, and roll percentile dice. If you roll a number equal to or lower than your votary level, your deity intervenes. The DM chooses the nature of the intervention; the effect of any votary spell or votary domain spell would be appropriate. If your deity intervenes, you can't use this feature again for 7 days. Otherwise, you can use it again after you finish a long rest.
At 20th level, your call for intervention succeeds automatically, no roll required.

feature.name: Destroy Monstrosity (CR 2)
